channel.title: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)
channel.description:
Hello,
For the last two days I've been trying to start my own server, the first one is just a test if I can get a server live. I'm having some problems, I can load the server and client and join it but when others try they can't. I've tried to check if I've port forwarded correctly with canyouseeme website and I get this: [code]Error: I could not see your service on 78.149.xxx.xx on port (43594) Reason: Connection timed out[/code] I have a dynamic IP (one that changes everytime my router resets) so I set up No-IP but it doesn't seem to work. I think the problem might be with the port forwarding because I'm not sure how to set it up on my router (Huawei EchoLife HG 532). I've included some screenshots from my routers settings because there are too many of them, as well as screenshots of No-IP.
Please help me if you can, if you don't understand post below and I'l try to clarify my questions.
Screenshots:
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/713/statusyy.jpg/][IMG]http://img713.imageshack.us/img713/5493/statusyy.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/862/ss26m.jpg/][IMG]http://img862.imageshack.us/img862/5596/ss26m.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/210/ss25e.jpg/][IMG]http://img210.imageshack.us/img210/180/ss25e.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/4/ss24q.jpg/][IMG]http://img4.imageshack.us/img4/2888/ss24q.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/441/ss23y.jpg/][IMG]http://img441.imageshack.us/img441/1992/ss23y.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/802/screenshot023c.jpg/][IMG]http://img802.imageshack.us/img802/3917/screenshot023c.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/823/basice.jpg/][IMG]http://img823.imageshack.us/img823/5619/basice.th.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/151/advancedp.jpg/][IMG]http://img151.imageshack.us/img151/6847/advancedp.th.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)
item.dc:creator: @Spandzbab Spandzbab
item.description:
@Spandzbab wrote:

Will do, but I think it’s the internet provider that might be blocking mine but not sure. I can get every other port to run but not 43594.

Read full topic

you no i am having the same problem if u find a sollution could u please help me thank you!

item.title: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)
item.dc:creator: @Spandzbab Spandzbab
item.description:
@Spandzbab wrote:

Yes I’ve tried disabling both the windows 7 firewall and the one I have with my anti-virus and then trying it but it still doesn’t work.

These are some ports I’ve tried with uTorrent:
Your ISP is not blocking port 48903
I could not see your service on xxx.xxx.xxx.xx on port (24906)
Your ISP is not blocking port 25013
Your ISP is not blocking port 36768
Your ISP is not blocking port 25915

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)

item.title: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)

item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

did you turned you firewalls off?

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)

item.title: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)
item.dc:creator: @Spandzbab Spandzbab
item.description:
@Spandzbab wrote:

Yes I want to run it from my pc, it’s just a test server at the moment to see if I can actually get it live so others can join it.

So I downloaded uTorrent and set it up changed the port to 43594 and it still says connection timed out but when I changed the port to 800 for example and tried it it said that my ISP is not blocking the port 800.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)

item.title: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)
item.dc:creator: @dzeko dzeko
item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

Spandzbab:

And there is no other way to go about it? I have to download uTorrent ?

utorrent is the easy way of doing it…
yes you have to download utorrent than go
Options / Preferences / Connection
and you will see “port used for incoming connections:” change the port to “43594”.
and do not change anything else but the port…
Than apply and there you go.

i guess you are hosting it on your computer? not on a vps right.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up server help (Can't get server to go live)
